meanings.definition: In a swollen or distended manner.
meanings.sent1: The balloon turgidly floated in the air.
meanings.sent2: The river turgidly overflowed its banks after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent3: The overly full suitcase turgidly refused to close.
meanings.sent4: His ego turgidly expanded with each compliment he received.
meanings.sent5: The bloated frog turgidly hopped along the path.

meanings.definition: In a pompous or pretentious manner.
meanings.sent1: He turgidly boasted about his achievements to anyone who would listen.
meanings.sent2: The politician turgidly delivered his speech, full of empty promises.
meanings.sent3: The peacock strutted turgidly, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent4: Her writing style was turgidly ornate, filled with unnecessary words.
meanings.sent5: The king turgidly paraded through the streets, adorned in extravagant robes.
